Treatment Title: Replace all openings required in floor slabs with precast  service openings.
Avoid holes - consider alternatives to achieve design purposes.
Cast in mesh in openings to reduce risk of person falling through.
Reduce hole sizes.
Group small floor openings together to create one large opening.
Locate floor openings away from passageways, work areas, and the structure perimeter.
Engage Structural engineer with architects to assist in design of handrail and guard elements.
Engage with contractors and temp. works at appointment.
Avoid low walls in circulation areas.
Avoid hidden alcoves and offsets.
Avoid trap hazards near openings.
Design permanent grating in opening, to be installed when opening is created during construction.
Specify guardrail systems around floor openings except at the entrance to stairways.
Identify covering strong enough to support any loads likely to be placed on it ; and fixed in position to prevent accidental dislodgement.
Avoid risk of objects falling from holes/openings on workers below.
Provide requisite guardrails and toe boards at all slab openings.
Provide warning markings and/or colour change.
Provide protective grate to support weight of person over opening.
Use safety nets fixed directly below the opening.
Inform contractor to Design-in permanent cast-in sockets around floor openings to enable early installation of permanent railings.
Identify safe working load  (swl) of temporary covers in slab floor and specify fixings
Securely fix  cover with adequate safe working load (SWL) over opening with fixings requiring a tool.
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Inspect protective measures regularly
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Ensure work is carried out only when weather conditions do not jeopardise the   health and safety of the workers.

Treatment Title: Provide safe lighting levels, including access and depression.

Treatment Title: Consider indicating pathways and adding tie-offs.(Clarify please)

Treatment Title: Every temporary floor opening shall be constantly attended by someone.

Treatment Title: Inform Site team of any activities when covers or guardrails need to be removed.
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Site team required to highlight and report any changes  on-site affecting the design
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Contractor should identify all remaining opening/edges and check  the selected permanent safety measures
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Consider use of transition blocks for services to pass through.
Consider Steel frame construction with composite floor slabs
Design alternative solutions to the opening
Consider forming full slab and cutting out openings when needed
Consider Location of penetration
Design solution should consider construction and in-use needs.
Consider the floor material to prevent slippery surface near openings.
Design in cast in sockets for handrail protection
Leave creation of penetrations later date in schedule
Create walkways with signs and barriers to avoid the openings
Inform contractor of need for  inspection at suitable intervals
Housekeeping on site to prevent trip hazards near openings.
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Use safety nets fixed over the hole to catch falling objects.
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Provide warning markings and/or colour change.
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Combine multiple penetrations in to lesser number
Ensure that the building height and area per floor meet all local building code requirements for the type of construction used.
Minimize the number of offsets, and make the offsets a consistent size and as large as possible for the floor layout.
Engage Structural engineer with architects to assist in design of handrail and guard elements.
Provide adequate railing or other means of fall protection along exposed perimeter of the building.
Consider  the design of cladding and joints  of walls  to ensure  that the interface of slab and vertical element is managed.
Inform the contractor to assess the formwork and falsework to be used (how it works with the construction sequence and building shape).
Provide requisite guardrails and toe boards at all slab edges.
Inform contractor to Design-in permanent cast-in sockets around floor openings to enable early installation of permanent railings.
Inspect protective measures regularly
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Ensure work is carried out only when weather conditions do not jeopardise the   health and safety of the workers.

Treatment Title: Consider pre cast sections with edge protection
Consider steel frame which is easier to manage and can be lifted with edge protection attached
Ensure falsework can be used for edge protection
Consider staged perimeter construction prior to casting floor slabs
Cast in slots for edge protection
Install internal precast staircases as construction progresses
Design in hooks for netting
Structural engineer to understand system of erection
Provide good access and ground conditions to area
Programme for the project to take activities into consideration to reduce exposure to edges
Install walkway routes to avoid edge
Schedule to consider critical path for progressive construction
Erect scaffolding to progressively protect edges
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Adequate access equipment MEWPs etc..
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Prevent fall by safety netting
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Install anchor point for harness
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Operatives to wear harnesses near edge.
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Avoid designing equipment or elevated features next to roof edges.
Avoid roof mounted extractors that require manual inspection or maintenance
Where necessary to locate equipment within 3m from edge of roof, provide railings or means of securing fall protection devices with appropriate signage.
Integrate upstands at edge details.
Preferably design minimum 1.1. m height parapets or railings at all roof edges.
Avoid specifying fragile materials for skylights.
Structural engineer liaises with architects during design phase to assist in design of handrail and guard elements.
Gantry systems can be designed to maintain atriums and skylights.
Provide adequate railing or other means of fall protection along exposed perimeter of the building
Provide safe access directly to all roof levels or from level to level (protected ladder, ships ladder, stairs).
If height parapets or railings at all roof edges of min 1.1 are not designed, alternatively, provide safety line anchor points along all roof edges.
Provide re-bars in skylight frame to avoid fall if skylight should break.
Guard  every skylight opening and hole by skylight screen or a fixed standard railing on all exposed sides.
Install permanent anchorage points on roof slabs to provide permanent anchor points for fall arrest systems.
If a walkway on a roof  is to be designed for equipment operation and maintenance, the related requirements must be followed. Link …..
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Once roof anchors are  installed ,it is generally the responsibility of the building owner to inspect and maintain roof anchors to ensure their continued and reliable performance.
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Contractor should identify all remaining opening/edges and check  the selected permanent safety measures
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Design components to facilitate prefabrication at ground level and erection as complete assemblies.
Designers should consider the sequences of construction between the temporary state and the finished state.
Minimize number of offsets in building plan and make offsets a consistent size and as large as possible to simplify work area for construction workers.
Where possible, specify shop welded connections instead of bolts or field welds to avoid dangerous or awkward positions for the welder or connector.
Ensure swl floor slabs is adequate to support MEWPs  for fixing at height.
Provide adequate safety standards for installing joist.
Avoid hanging connections—design to bear on columns instead.
Avoid connections or protrusions above floor framing members
Specify safety seats for beam connections, markings for orientation, and secure connections and anchoring systems.
Use safety nets or soft landing bags to mitigate consequences of falls between joists
Design adequate anchorage points for fall restraint systems
Use of harness at heights
Establish a clear and consistent beam marking system to help workers orient themselves to hazards in certain sections of the structure and increase erection speed.
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Contractor should identify all remaining beam spacing and check  the selected permanent safety measures
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Avoid designing In-situ stairways.
Consider using prefabricated or ground-assembled stairways which can be erected as one assembly.
If in-stu are unavoidable , consider designing stairs that can be built using stair-masters, which are with permanent framework and permanent rails pre-attached.
Locate exterior stairs and ramps on the sheltered side of the structure (parallel to the building) to protect them from rain, snow, and ice.
Avoid stair landings constructed separate from the stairs.
Maintain a uniform stair slope throughout the project.
The spacing between vertical stair rails should be less than 100 mm to prevent children’s legs from slipping through the gap.
Provide railing on all exposed sides (except at entrance to stairway)
Specify staircases to have sockets casted in the concrete or welded in steel sections on open sides/edges to fix guardrails during construction.
Provide engineering documents and schedule permanent stairways to be constructed as soon as possible.
Design and schedule handrails, guardrails, and stair rails to be erected as part of the structural steel erection.
Establish survey control "permanently" so that when structures are erected, survey control monuments are still accessible.
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Provide broom finish on all exposed concrete stair surfaces
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Contractor should identify all remaining stairs and check  the selected permanent safety measures
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Use prefabricated riser on buildings
Design of temporary works for gaining access at height in shaft.
Chases or holes should be detailed to be cast into the unit and not cut or drilled later
Information on permanent walls
Mount emergency lighting in stairwells to be easily accessible, and avoid locations over treads.
Cast in provision for guardrails at shaft openings.
Information to contractor -specify activities that will require access at height to shaft to resource and plan for access measures
Competent person to sign off any access arrangements at height in the shaft
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Maximize prefabrication on the ground level  and minimize the need of fixing in heights.
Liaise with contractor  to identify the most appropriate edge protection
Davits can be installed to provide a permanent suspension system.
Monorail systems can be installed be used to suspend work platforms.
Reduce the need to handle heavy glazing units.
Develop cladding details to provide primary attachments that are safe and easy to use in all locations
Design elements so that they can be cleaned and replaced safely.
Locate to be easily accessible by maintenance staff.
If bespoke cladding to be used - carry out design review with specialist contractor and suppliers
Coordinate with structure engineers to ensure primary fixings are safe and easy to install.
Ensure the safe access for cleaning, inspection and maintenance.
Provide roof anchor points for using harness for cleaning near edges.
Conisder operable windows for cleaning from inside.
Consider access needs for cherry pickers for maintenace and cleaning
Maximize the use of mechanical handling.
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control

Treatment Title: Where practical, specify prefabricated roof structures, rather than individual members.
Consider designing low-pitch roofs  (less than 30 degree)
Design roof structure with a maximum spacing of 600 mm between trusses and rafters.
Prefabricate roof structures on ground to minimise work at height
Where practical, consider including a permanent safety mesh underneath the roof.
Provide re-bars in skylight frame to avoid fall if skylight should break.
The fragile roof area should be enclosed by permeant guardrails.
Install permanent anchorage points on roof slabs to provide permanent tie-offs points for fall arrest systems.
A permanent warning sign to be fixed near the area where the roof is covered with fragile material.
Consider alternatives to tube and fitting scaffoldings.
Make provisions for scaffolding or anchors.
Inform designers to provide the information required to help the temporary works coordinator
Consider potential for designing temporary works which can become permanent i.e. do not require removal
A metal bracket is permanently connected to a concrete floor deck or steel.
Scaffolds should be designed, erected, altered and dismantled only by competent people and the work should always be carried out under the direction of a competent supervisor.
Ensure that the preferred solution takes advantage of new developments in access equipment.
TW designer to specify when permanent strength of structure is achieved and temporary supports can be removed
Contractor to identify safety critical elements of temporary works and ensure site operatives understand which elements  cannot be disturbed.
Provide a 180 degree hook or impaling cap on the end of all wall reinforcing bars.
Treatment Stage: Site work, Temp Works, Change control
